RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. INNER TURF (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred). (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRADE IMBALANCE came in a few paths after the start then was corrected by the rider, was caught five wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, was roused in the four path on the far turn, rallied five wide into the stretch under a left-handed crop, closed well to get the lead outside the furlong marker, shook clear outside the sixteenth-pole then drifted out under a left-handed crop, was straightened about forty yards from the finish and just out-nodded the runner-up on the line. AGATE ROAD was fractious in the gate, broke awkwardly and was off slow, spotted the front a few lengths, took an awkward stride shortly after the start, saved ground while well behind the vanguard going around the opening bend, was urged well off the pace, went two then three wide under strong encouragement early on the far turn then angled five wide, gained six wide into the stretch, pursed the winner on the outside while still on his inside lead, drifted in while closing on that foe into the final sixteenth, took a narrow advantage while head-bobbing with the winner late and was denied while clear for the place. LE GRIS broke in then was corrected by the rider, prompted the pace outside of the leader in the two path while loosely between foes, was asked outside the five-sixteenths, battled under a drive in upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened but just earned the show. ASPENITE went to the front, showed the way on the inside while inside of foes, vied along the rail while inside of one opponent on the far turn, was asked at the quarter-pole then came under the crop in upper stretch, lost the advantage outside the furlong marker and weakened then just missed the show. DRILLING FOR GOLD broke a bit in the air and was off slow, spotted the front several lengths, was urged in the two path on the first turn, settled at the rear, went two then three wide on the far turn, angled out in upper stretch and was no factor. FALFURRIAS was fractious in the gate, veered in at the start then bumped very hard with a foe, went four wide while between horses on the first turn, moved in early on the backstretch, was well placed on the inside, came up empty along the rail on the far turn and retreated. ALLIED ATTACK was bumped very hard at the start, showed speed in the three path while between horses on the first turn, tracked outside on the backstretch, was urged along passing the eleven-sixteenths, came up empty while three then two wide on the far turn and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Aspenite
ENTRY.COMMENT: to front,inside pace,ins foes,asked1/4,headed1/8,wknd,lost 3rd

ENTRY.NAME: Le Gris
ENTRY.OWNER: Madison Stewart Mather Couch Thomas J Landry Stephen and Stall Jr Albert M
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in,2p1st,prompt pace,2p2nd,ask out5/16,vied to1/8,wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Agate Road
ENTRY.OWNER: Repole Stable and St Elias Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate,awkwrd brk,off slw,awkrd stride,urged,5w5/16,6w1/4

ENTRY.NAME: Allied Attack
ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd very hard brk,3p1st,trckd out,urged4-1/2,empty3-2p2nd,falter

ENTRY.NAME: Drilling for Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke in air,off slw,2p1st,at rear,2-3p2nd,angled out,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Falfurrias
ENTRY.COMMENT: frctious gate,veer in,bmp hrd,4p1st,mvd in,well placed,ins,falter

ENTRY.NAME: Trade Imbalance
ENTRY.COMMENT: came in after brk,5w1st,out,ask4p2nd,5p1/4,lead1/8,drift1/16,held

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of FAH

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 80. Maiden Special Weight Purse 136500. (PURSE $105,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $23,751 NYSBFOA) FOR MAIDENS, TWO YEARS OLD. Weight, 119 lbs. (Non-Starters For A Claiming Price Of $40,000 Or Less In The Last 3 Starts Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUST STEEL coaxed from the gate, prompted the pace of OZONE from the outside three wide, tucked to the two path advancing on the leader to duel with that rival coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, took over command narrowly and got brushed and traded a light bump nearing the eighth pole with BE YOU, got headed by that rival a furlong out, dug in to the inside of that rival getting nudged inwards a path or two to the finish and took back the front gamely seventy yards from home before prevailing at the end. BE YOU settled chasing along the inside just off the duel up front, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and began to tip out culminating in swinging six wide into upper stretch, came in on the wrong lead and brushed and traded a bump with JUST STEEL nearing the eighth pole, grabbed narrow command at that station, dug in coming inwards and floating in the aforementioned foe a path or two to the finish getting headed seventy yards from home, fought game but was ultimately bested at the end. LOCKED got forced to steady at the start when DOMESTIC PRODUCT veered in and conceded five to six lengths to the front before being able to settle into stride, chased four then three wide coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide into upper stretch and showed good courage to close in and secure the show honors unable to threaten the top pair while well clear of the rest. OZONE hustled from the gate, showed the way just off the inside lightly coaxed down the backstretch under some pressure from JUST STEEL before having that rival advance outside, dueled through the turn, spun just off the inside into upper stretch under threat, yielded straightened away and weakened to the finish. DOMESTIC PRODUCT veered in at the start taking over the lane of LOCKED and forcing that rival to steady out, chased three to four wide under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled out seven wide into upper stretch and offered no response. HAMILTON'S WAY broke in a step at the start, chased just off the inside until tucked inside through the turn coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, continued in the inside route into upper stretch and made no impact. PENTATHLON chased three then two wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch, made no impact. UNO MAS BOURBON chased just off the duel four paths off the inside down the backstretch and then just off the inside through the turn coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, went six to seven wide into upper stretch and tired. BADLANDS RULER hustled from the gate, chased just off the inside, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths and floated out three then four wide through the turn, went eight wide into upper stretch and folded. CREEK chased five then four wide coming under coaxing three furlongs from home, angled six wide into upper stretch, never got involved.

ENTRY.NAME: Be You
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off duel ins, 6w upper, brush foe, up 1/8, duel, bested

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Hamilton's Way
ENTRY.OWNER: West Paces Racing LLC and Hoffman Thoroughbreds
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk in step st, chased 2p, coaxed ins 3/8, inside 1/4, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Pentathlon
ENTRY.OWNER: Phipps Stable St Elias Stable and Woodford Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 3-2w, coaxed 3/8, 2w 1/4p, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Locked
ENTRY.OWNER: Eclipse Thoroughbred Partners and Walmac Farm
ENTRY.COMMENT: steadied st, chased 4-3w, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, good courage

ENTRY.NAME: Domestic Product
ENTRY.COMMENT: veered in st, chased 3-4w, coaxed 3/8, 7w upper, no response

ENTRY.NAME: Ozone
ENTRY.OWNER: Siena Farm LLC and WinStar Farm LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, lightly coaxed 2p, dueled turn, 2w 1/4, yielded, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Badlands Ruler
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled st, chased 2p, coaxed 7/16, floated 3-4w, 8w uppr, folded

ENTRY.NAME: Creek
ENTRY.OWNER: Claiborne Farm and Dilschneider, Adele B.
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 5-4w, coaxed 3/8, 6w upper, never involved

ENTRY.NAME: Uno Mas Bourbon
ENTRY.OWNER: Bourbon Lane Stable (J Hill M McMahon) and Six Column Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: just off duel 4p, 2p turn, coaxed 5/16, 6-7w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Just Steel
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, prompted 3p, dueled 2p turn, 4w upper, dug in, game

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 3 7F Dirt CR: 97. Claiming Purse 52000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Weight, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races In 2023 Allowed 3 lbs. A Race In 2023 Allowed 5 lbs. Claiming Price $20,000 (Maiden And Claiming Races For $16,000 Or Less Not Considered In Allowances) (1.5% Aftercare Assessment Du e At Time Of Claim Otherwise Claim Will Be Void).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: VICTORIOUS WAVE showed speed then pressed the pace on the outside, took the lead in the three path at the three-eighths pole, was roused at the quarter-pole, shook clear into the final furlong and proved best under strong urging. BEACHWALKER was urged along off the pace, moved closer with five furlongs to run, continued to advance late on the backstretch, made a rail bid inside of two foes coming to the three-eighths pole, turned into upper stretch under a drive while inside of the winner, lost touch with that foe into the final furlong and was outfinished while well clear for the place. NO MORE TALK was well placed just off the pace, started the turn in the two path, shifted four wide at the three-eighths, spun six wide into the stretch and came up empty while best of the rest. RAGTIME BLUES broke a bit awkwardly, moved up under urging to set the pace under pressure to his outside, vied in the two path under threat from both sides early on the turn, lost the advantage at the three-eighths pole, dropped back at the five-sixteenths pole and tired. WINNING DRIVE was ridden along off the pace, went three then four wide on the turn, came six wide into the stretch and failed to respond. DONTBELATE broke out then was hustled, lugged out under heavy left-rein pressure, brushed with a foe in the process, bolted on the turn, came away out towards the outside fence and was eased but walked off. GLORY ROAD was taken up while in tight early then moved to the outside, brushed with DONTBELATE while carried out by that foe on the backstretch, was forced out nine wide near the seven-sixteenths, dropped back then moved to the five path before the five-sixteenths and was eased then vanned off.

ENTRY.NAME: Ragtime Blues
ENTRY.COMMENT: bit awkward brk,mvd up,set pressured pace,2p,headed3/8,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Winning Drive
ENTRY.COMMENT: ridden along,3-4wide turn,6w into lane,no response

ENTRY.NAME: Beachwalker
ENTRY.COMMENT: urged along,mvd up5/8,rail bid 3/8,drp back1/8,outfinished,clr2nd

ENTRY.NAME: No More Talk
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed,shifted 2-4p turn,6p1/4,empty,best of rest

ENTRY.NAME: Glory Road
ENTRY.COMMENT: tkn up early,mvd out,carried out,forced 9w 7/16,5w5/16,easd,vannd

ENTRY.NAME: Dontbelate
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,luggd out,bolted turn,eased,walked off

ENTRY.NAME: Victorious Wave
ENTRY.OWNER: Epona Racing Stable and Toga Party Racing Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed,press outside,lead 3path3/8,shook clear1/8,driving

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 4 1M Dirt CR: 92. Allowance Purse 95000. INNER TURF FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 1 25 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ZEEBEAR dueled from the two path with SHARED SUCCESS to his inside, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths shaking away and crossing nearer to the inside forcing his former pace rival to tip out a path, came under challenge from the runner up and floated that rival out four to five wide, then went clear under a drive to prevail. NOBLE HUNTSMAN chased along the inside from the tail of the field early on, came under coaxing and advanced strongly tipping two then three wide and nudging SELL SOMETHING to the four path, offered up a bid to issue a challenge nearing the quarter pole and angled out five wide when the leader floated in front four wide, tucked four wide as that foe went to the five path straightened away, then proved no match while keeping on to secure the place honors. SHARED SUCCESS dueled inside of ZEEBEAR from the early stages, got shaken off at the seven-sixteenths and came under coaxing at that juncture tipping out a path as the leader came inwards slightly, swung three wide for home and weakened. SELL SOMETHING coaxed from the gate, chased just off the inside coming under coaxing at the half mile pole, got nudged three then four wide at the three-eighths, went six wide into upper stretch and weakened. GIMMEDAMONEY bobbled at the start, chased three wide under coaxing from the five-sixteenths, spun two to three wide for home and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Noble Huntsman
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, coaxed 3/8, tip 3w 3/8, bid 5-4w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Sell Something
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2p, coaxed 1/2p, nudged 4w 3/8, 6w uppr, wknd

ENTRY.NAME: Gimmedamoney
ENTRY.OWNER: Bisso, Jr., Louis A. and LeCesse, Michael A.
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled st, chased 3w, coaxed 5/16, 2-3w upper, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Shared Success
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled ins, shaken off 7/16, 3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Zeebear
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 2p, coaxed 7/16, floated 4-5w upper, went clear

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 94. Allowance Purse 95000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD FOALED IN NEW YORK STATE AND APPROVED BY THE NEW YORK STATE-BRED REGISTRY WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STRAIGHT ARROW stalked the pace on the outside, made a bid leaving the backstretch, vied in the three path while asked on the turn, was driven four wide into the stretch, battled outside of the runner-up into the final furlong, drew even with that foe into the final sixteenth, drifted in and bumped lightly about forty yards from the finish and got up to prevail. BE THE BOSS broke out then was hustled, contested the pace on the outside, vied inside of a foe in the two path on the turn, was roused near the quarter-pole then came under a drive in upper stretch, led to the sixteenth-pole, was bumped lightly by the winner while on even terms about forty yards from the finish and was caught while clear for the place. SAFALOW'S MISSION bobbled slightly at the start, settled towards the rear, was taken in hand briefly between foes outside the five-eighths, went three then four wide under urging on the turn, came five wide into the stretch and lacked the needed response while up for the show. QUICK TO ACCUSE was hustled from the gate, established a good position just off the pace, was shuffled back some behind GOLDEN ARM as that foe came back at the seven-sixteenths, was roused while moving from the rail to three wide on the turn, spun four wide into the stretch under a drive, drifted out under a left-handed crop outside the sixteenth-pole and missed the show. GOLDEN ARM disputed the pace on the inside of a rival, dropped back leaving the backstretch, chased inside on the turn and tired. THANK YOU JON was rated just off the pace, chased two then three wide on the turn and came up empty. ASAP RESTORATION was ridden along at the rear, angled in outside the five-eighths then was straightened, went four then five wide on the turn and was no factor. TWO FOR CHARGING was re-positioned by an assistant starter in the gate, settled near the back, saved ground on the turn and faltered then was eased but walked off.

ENTRY.NAME: Quick to Accuse
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed,shuffled bit 7/16,ins-3p trn,4w1/4,drift out,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Two for Charging
ENTRY.COMMENT: re-positioned gate,towards rear,ins turn,faltered,eased,wlkd off

ENTRY.NAME: Golden Arm
ENTRY.COMMENT: pace inside foe,dropped back7/16,chsd inside turn,tired

ENTRY.NAME: Safalow's Mission
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbld bit brk,settled,in hand btwn5-1/2,3-4w trn,5w1/4,best rest

ENTRY.NAME: Thank You Jon
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated just of pace, chased 2-3path turn, came up empty

ENTRY.NAME: Be the Boss
ENTRY.OWNER: Nice Guys Stables Oringer Jay Al Bianchi Racing LLC and Hornstock Steve
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,hstld,out pace,2p trn,ask1/4,led to1/16,light bmp,denied

ENTRY.NAME: Asap Restoration
ENTRY.COMMENT: ridden along,angled in 5-1/2,4-5wide turn,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Straight Arrow
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked outside,bid7/16,3path turn,4p1/4,out,drift in late,bmp,up

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Troy S. - Grade3 SARATOGA RACE 6 5 1/2F Turf CR: 105. Stakes Purse 300000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $300 each which should accompany the nomination; $1,500 to pass the entry box and an additional $1,500 to start . For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $1,500 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourt h, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight, 124 lbs. Non-winners of $110,000 in 2022-23 allowed 2 lbs.; of a sweepstake in 2023 allowed 4 lbs.; of two races other than maiden, claiming, starter or State-bred allowance in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. Trophy will be presented to the winning owner. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to transfer this race to the Main Track. In the event that this race is taken off the turf it may be subject to downgrading upon reviewb
RACE.FOOTNOTES: COGBURN got bumped at the start by IKIGAI and in turn bumped CARAVEL, chased along the inside from mid pack, came under coaxing near the quarter pole and angled four wide into upper stretch, rallied to issue a challenge through the final furlong, bobbled just outside the sixteenth pole and then again just inside the sixteenth marker when attempting to collar the leader, seized command seventy yards from the finish, dug in to prevail at the end. NOBALS coaxed from the gate, showed the way in hand just off the inside under pressure from REMUDA to the outside, tucked inside through the turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole and took the inside route into upper stretch, edged away under a drive to the eighth pole, dug in under growing late threat and was caught with seventy yards to the finish and forced to settle for the place honors. THIN WHITE DUKE broke out a step at the start getting away and then grew briefly detached at the tail of the field when devoid of speed, chased just off the inside down the backstretch and then three wide through the turn under coaxing from the three-eighths, angled five to six wide into upper stretch and kicked on belatedly to procure the show honors. CARAVEL got bumped at the start by COGBURN due to pressure from IKIGAI, came under coaxing and led briefly before being headed by NOBALS shortly after, chased along the inside down the backstretch, tipped briefly to the two path at the seven-sixteenths before heading three wide at the three-eighths, came under coaxing with five-sixteenths to go, angled five wide into upper stretch and floated out two to three additional paths straightened away, then stayed on one paced through to the finish. REMUDA pressed the pace of NOBALS from the outside three to four paths off the inside down the backstretch and then from the two path through the turn, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide for home, weakened in the late stages, then was reported to have bled. MISTER MMMMM coaxed from the start, chased two to three wide down the backstretch and then four wide through the turn and into upper stretch and tired. IKIGAI broke out a step at the start bumping COGBURN into CARAVEL, chased just off the inside under coaxing from the seven-sixteenths, continued just off the inside for home and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Thin White Duke
ENTRY.OWNER: Gleaves Philip A Crist Steven deRegt Ken and Hilliard Bryan
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out step st, chased 2p, coaxed 3w 3/8, 5-6w upper, belatedly

ENTRY.NAME: Ikigai
ENTRY.OWNER: Ten Strike Racing Four Corners Racing and Cory Moelis Racing LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out step st, chased 2p, coaxed 7/16, 2w 1/4p, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Cogburn
ENTRY.OWNER: Brewster Clark O Heiligbrodt L William and Heiligbrodt Corinne
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, chased ins, 4w uppr, bobbled 2x str, up fin 70yds

ENTRY.NAME: Caravel
ENTRY.OWNER: Qatar Racing Detampel Marc and Madaket Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped st, led briefly, chased ins, tip 3w 3/8,5w uppr, one paced

ENTRY.NAME: Mister Mmmmm
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, chased 2-3w backstretch, 4w turn, 4w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Nobals
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand 2p, ins turn, ins 1/4, edged away, caught late

ENTRY.NAME: Remuda
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed 3-2w, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, wknd late, bled

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Fasig-Tipton Lure S. SARATOGA RACE 7 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 112. Stakes Purse 135000. INNER TURF FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A GRADED SWEEPSTAKE IN 2023. This is a Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $135 each which should accompany the nomina tion; $675 to pass the entry box and an additional $675 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $675 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divid ed 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weights 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Graded sweepstake on the turf in 2022 allowed 2 lbs.; of a sweepstake other than state-b red in 2023 allowed 4 lbs.; of a sweepstake other than state-bred in 2022 or two races other than maiden, claiming, starter or State-bred allowance in 2023 allowed 6 lbs. A presentation will be made to the winning owner. The New York Racing Association re
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SMOKIN' T was reserved in the middle of the field on the inside, came under urging late on the backstretch, angled three then four wide on the far turn, bobbled near the five-sixteenths, rallied to make a bid between foes into upper stretch, fought between two rivals in the final furlong and gamely prevailed. DAKOTA GOLD was taken in hand between horses early, rounded the first turn in the two path, was reserved well off the pace, gained three wide early on the far turn then shifted five wide while closing fast, made an outside bid into upper stretch, fought outside of two foes in the final furlong and just missed while narrowly able to get the place. PORTFOLIO COMPANY dropped back along the rail early, fell well off the pace while saving ground, gained on the final turn, paused in traffic while closing fast late on that bend, found room between horses to make a bid into upper stretch, battled inside of the top two in the final furlong and just missed while clear for the show. SPEAKING SCOUT hit the inside of the gate at the start then moved in early, saved ground while unhurried at the back, was roused on the final turn, spun three wide into the stretch, moved out outside the furlong marker and finished willingly for the last spot in the superfecta. DOCTOR DAVIS showed early speed on the inside of a foe under urging then was taken in hand while beaten to the front, raced in the three path on the first turn, stalked the pace on the outside, ranged up in the three path on the far turn, made a brief bid into upper stretch, dropped back into the final furlong and weakened. TIZ THE BOMB moved in at the rear, traveled three wide going around the first turn, settled at the back, was urged along in the two path on the far turn, swung five wide into the stretch and failed to threaten. OCEAN ATLANTIQUE was hustled from the gate, went around the first turn in the two path, was reserved on the outside, came under urging in a good striking position on the far turn, dropped to the rail coming to the quarter-pole and capitulated. MID DAY IMAGE hit the outside of the gate at the start, moved in while asked for speed, showed the way in the two path, dropped to the rail at the quarter-pole then was swallowed up into upper stretch and tired.

ENTRY.NAME: Portfolio Company
ENTRY.COMMENT: drp bck ins,rsrvd,gain2nd,traffic 2p ins5/16,bid btwn3/16,fought

ENTRY.NAME: Smokin' T
ENTRY.COMMENT: reserved inside,angled 3-4w2nd turn,bobbld5/16,bid3/16,gamely

ENTRY.NAME: Dakota Gold
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand btwn,2p1st,resrvd,gain 3-5w2nd,bid3/16,outside duo,missd

ENTRY.NAME: Ocean Atlantique
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled,2p1st,reserved outside,ask2p2nd turn,rail1/4,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Speaking Scout
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate,mvd in,reserved ins,ask2nd turn,3w1/4,mvd out,willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Tiz the Bomb
ENTRY.COMMENT: mvd in,3p1st,well back,urged 2p2nd turn,5w into lane,no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Doctor Davis
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed,in hand,mvd out,3p1st,stlkd out,3p2nd,bid1/4,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Mid Day Image
ENTRY.OWNER: Winning Move Stable, Sanford H. Robbins LLC and Jacobson, David
ENTRY.COMMENT: hit gate,speed,angld in,pace 2path,ask2nd,headed3/16,tired

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of CUR

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Test S. - Grade1 SARATOGA RACE 8 7F Dirt CR: 105. Stakes Purse 500000. FOR FILLIES THREE YEARS OLD. Non-Lasix race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. By subscription of $500 each which should accompany the nomination; $3,500 to pass the entry box and an additional $4,000 to start. For horses not originally nominated, a supplemental payment of $2,500 in addition to the entry and starting fees may be made at any time prior to the closing of entries. The purse to be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to second, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weight 124 lbs. Non-winners of a Grade One in 2023 or two Grade Two races in 2023 allowed 2 lbs.; of a Grade One in 2022 or a Grade Two in 2023 allowed 4 lbs.; of a Graded sweepstake all owed 6 lbs. Trophies will be presented to the winning owner, trainer and jockey. Closed Saturday, July 22, 2023 with 18 Nominations.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRETTY MISCHIEVOUS three wide in pursuit from near the rear of the field, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, angled six wide into upper stretch, offered up a mild kick willingly through the stretch to the finish kept to task. CLEARLY UNHINGED chased along the inside, went to tip to the two path near the nine-sixteenths and clipped the back of JERSEY PEARL bobbling at that station, chased just off the inside through the turn coming under coaxing near the quarter pole, went five wide into upper stretch, ran on to the finish. MUNNYS GOLD raced three wide in closest aim of the leader at times latching on to press the pace, came under coaxing near the quarter pole, angled four wide into upper stretch, offered up a bid a furlong out, kept on under a drive to the wire. DORTH VADER chased four wide coming under encouragement three furlongs from home, angled five wide into upper stretch, kept on to the finish. JERSEY PEARL chased along the inside, got clipped behind when CLEARLY UNHINGED tipped to the two path from in behind her at the nine-sixteenths, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, continued inside into upper stretch and floated to the two path straightened away, then weakened in the stretch. TAPPIN JOSIE two to three wide in pursuit, came under coaxing at the seven-sixteenths, continued two to three wide into upper stretch, tired. MAPLE LEAF MEL established the front from the get go and showed the way in hand three then two wide, remained patiently handled through the turn under some pressure from MUNNYS GOLD to the outside, continued two to three wide into upper stretch and was roused straightened away, edged clear to the eighth pole, remained clear inside the final sixteenth and was geared down inside the final seventy yards when suffering a catastrophic injury to the right front leg, fell in the shadow of the wire and was subsequently euthanized on track. There was a general Stewards' Inquiry into the stretch run before the race was declared official.

ENTRY.NAME: Pretty Mischievous
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, angled 6w upper, mild kick, willingly

ENTRY.NAME: Clearly Unhinged
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, clipped heels 9/16, 2p turn, 5w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Tappin Josie
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 2-3w, coaxed 7/16, 2-3w upper, tired

ENTRY.NAME: Jersey Pearl
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased ins, clipped beh 9/16, coaxed 3/8, ins 1/4, wknd late

ENTRY.NAME: Dorth Vader
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, angled 5w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Munnys Gold
ENTRY.OWNER: Low, Lawana L. and Robert E.
ENTRY.COMMENT: prompted 3w, coaxed near 1/4, angled 4w upper, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Maple Leaf Mel
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand 3-2w, 2-3w uppr, edged clear, injured, fell near finish

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Saratoga Derby Invitational S. - Grade1 SARATOGA RACE 9 1 3/16M Turf CR: 111. Stakes Purse 600000. AN INVITATIONAL FOR THREE-YEAR-OLDS. Non-Lasix Race pursuant to 4043.2 (7)(e)(5) Lasix not permitted within 48 hours of post time. $4,500 (USD) to enter and an additional $4,500 to start. The New York Racing Association and Moonee Valley Racing Club of Au stralia are proud to announce that the winner of the Saratoga Derby will receive an automatic berth into the the Group One $5 Million (AUD) Ladbrokes Cox Plate. The purse for the Saratoga Derby Invitational shall be divided 55% to the winner, 20% to secon d, 12% to third, 6% to fourth, 4% to fifth and 3% divided equally amongst the remaining finishers. Weights: Colts and Geldings, 122 lbs. Fillies, 119 lbs. Trophies will be presented to the winning owner, trainer and jockey. The New York Racing Association reserves the right to transfer this race to the Main Track. In the event that this race is taken off the turf, it may be subject to downgrading upon review by the Graded Stakes Committee. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on thet
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PROGRAM TRADING (GB) went to the front, showed the way in the two path, responded well when asked near the quarter-pole, came out five wide into the stretch, lost the advantage to the runner-up at the three-sixteenths, fought on well into the final furlong then was brushed, dueled gamely inside of the aforementioned foe into the final sixteenth then regained the lead and narrowly prevailed under strong urging. WEBSLINGER went four wide on the first turn, settled on the outside, moved closer midway down the backstretch, stalked four wide on the far turn, made a bid after being asked at the five-sixteenths, came six wide into the stretch, gained a short lead at the three-sixteenths, drifted in near the furlong marker then brushed with the winner inside that marker, led while dueling outside into the final sixteenth, fought to the finish and was denied while able to get the place. FAR BRIDGE was taken in hand early, went three then two wide on the first turn, was rated off the pace, came under urging in the five path on the far turn, was driven six wide into the stretch, chased the top two under a left-handed crop into the final sixteenth and lacked the needed winning kick but was clear for the show. BATTLE OF NORMANDY broke out and bumped with a rival, moved in while taken in hand, settled off the pace, was asked between foes in the three to four path on the far turn, came five wide into the stretch, remained on his inside lead in the drive and lacked the needed response. ASPEN GROVE (IRE) was fractious in the gate then backed out and reloaded, saved ground on the first turn, was reserved off the pace, came under encouragement in the two to three path on the far turn, dropped closer to the rail into the stretch and lacked the needed response. THE FRANCHISE (IRE) saved ground on the first turn, settled at the rear, was roused with a half-mile to run, moved from three to five wide while ridden along on the far turn, turned into upper stretch under a drive and lacked the needed response. MONDEGO (GB) became fractious in the gate after another foe did the same, was taken under a strong hold early and conceded the front, saved ground while rated just off the pace, was asked while inside to the two path on the far turn and came up empty. LION OF WAR (GB) was bumped at the start, moved up on the outside under some urging, went three wide on the first turn, stalked the pace on the outside, was given his cue in the three path on the final turn, spun four wide into the stretch and capitulated.

ENTRY.NAME: Mondego (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate,concede lead,rated ins,ask2nd ins-2p2nd turn,empty

ENTRY.NAME: Program Trading (GB)
ENTRY.COMMENT: to front,well ratd 2p,ask1/4,5w into lane,headed3/16,dueld,gamely

ENTRY.OWNER: Glen Hill Farm and Magnier Mrs John
ENTRY.COMMENT: fractious gate,reloaded,ins1st,rated,ask2-3p2nd,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: The Franchise (IRE)

TRACK.NAME: Foreign track with Code of CUR

ENTRY.OWNER: Lindy Farms Ice Wine Stable and Fielding John D
ENTRY.COMMENT: ins1st turn,at rear,ask1/2,3-5w2nd turn,no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Far Bridge
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand,3-2p1st,rated,ask5w2nd,6w1/4,chased,clear for show

ENTRY.NAME: Webslinger
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4p1st,settled out,closer4-1/2,bid4p2nd,6p1/4,led3/16,dueld,denied

ENTRY.NAME: Battle of Normandy
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds Woodford Racing LLC and Langone Ken
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,bmpd,2p1st,settled,ask3-4w2nd turn,5w1/4,ins lead,no kick

ENTRY.COMMENT: bmpd brk,coaxed,mvd up,3p1st,stlkd outside,ask3p2nd,4p1/4,empty

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Whitney S. - Grade1 SARATOGA RACE 10 1 1/8M Dirt CR: 114. Stakes Purse 1000000. FOR FOUR YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHITE ABARRIO forwardly placed from the start, raced three then two wide through the first turn before settling to attend the leader from the outside while three wide, remained patiently handled latched on to the outside applying pressure through his presence, got given a notch to work with at the five-sixteenths and took over the front nearing the quarter pole, swung four wide into upper stretch set down for the drive, drew clear under a drive drifting in to the two path a furlong out, then got flashed the crop to the left side and shied outwards before being ridden out to the finish through the final sixteenth. ZANDON raced along the inside through the first turn and then tracked from just off the inside just off the pace, came under light coaxing near the seven-sixteenths and tipped three wide, had the rider sneak a peek back looking for CODY'S WISH, tipped out four wide under urging at the three-eighths nearly in front of that rival, swung five wide into upper stretch, proved no match for the top one while running on clear of the rest to be along second best. CODY'S WISH was leaning on the right side of the stall a bit unprepared for the start when the latch was sprung and lost his hind footing skidding out of the gate and conceding three to four lengths to the front before settling into stride, chased just off the inside through the first turn at the tail of the field before tipping three to four paths off the rail down the backstretch, got given a notch to work with into the far turn before coming under coaxing just past the seven-sixteenths, followed ZANDON four wide through the bend and angled six wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive and improved position to just get up for the show honors on the wire. CHARGE IT coaxed from the gate, chased along the inside through the first turn and then three wide down the backstretch just off the pace, tucked to the two path into the far turn placed to prolonged coaxing half a mile from home, swung three wide into upper stretch and passed tired rivals to the finish just getting bested for the show honors in the final jumps. GIANT GAME coaxed from the gate, established the front narrowly and showed the way just off the inside through the first turn before taking to the rail down the backstretch under the watchful eye of WHITE ABARRIO and facing some pressure from that rival's presence latched on to the outside, tipped to the two path into the far turn, came under coaxing nearing the five-sixteenths under intensified challenge from his main pace prompter, yielded the front and swung three wide at the head of the stretch, then weakened in the drive. LAST SAMURAI three wide just off the pace through the first turn, chased four then three wide coming under urging at the seven-sixteenths, lost ground and swung four wide at the top of the stretch, faltered, and was eased home to the finish.

ENTRY.NAME: Zandon
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked 2p, tipped 3w 7/16, 4w 3/8, 5w uppr, no match, 2nd best

ENTRY.NAME: Charge It
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, 3-2w just off pace, coaxed 1/2, 3w uppr, by tired foes

ENTRY.NAME: Giant Game
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds and Albaugh Family Stables LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: coaxed st, in hand ins, tip 2p 1/2, yielded, 3w upper, weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Last Samurai
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3w 1st turn, just off pace 4-3w, urged 7/16, 4w uppr, eased home

ENTRY.NAME: White Abarrio
ENTRY.OWNER: C Two Racing Stable and Pagnano Antonio
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w 1st turn, attended 3p, set down 4w uppr, drew clear

ENTRY.NAME: Cody's Wish
ENTRY.COMMENT: lost footing, leaned on gate st, chased 3-4w, 6w upper, improved

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 11 7F Dirt CR: 104. Allowance Purse 149500. (PURSE $115,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $26,013 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter Allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: EVERSO MISCHIEVOUS broke out at the start, pressed the pace on the outside then in the three path on the turn, took a short advantage in upper stretch, remained on his inside lead until just inside the furlong marker then swapped to the proper lead, responded well to the challenge of the runner-up at that juncture and held under strong urging. CAPE TRAFALGAR broke out and hit the gate, was well placed on the inside, came off the rail on the turn, was driven four wide into the stretch, gained to make a bid inside the furlong marker, fought outside of the winner to the finish and was denied while clear for the place. FRAT PACK bobbled at the start, went to the front, showed the way under pressure to his outside, vied in the two path on the turn, lost the advantage to the winner in upper stretch, battled under a drive into the final furlong, dropped back into the final sixteenth and weakened but was clear for the show. CARAMEL CHIP tracked the pace down the backstretch, went three wide on the turn, was asked at the quarter-pole, angled out under a drive in upper stretch and lacked the needed response. TWELTH MAN settled off the pace, was roused in the two path on the turn, dropped to the rail outside the quarter-pole and failed to rally. BAD TO THE BONES settled off the pace, was roused three then four wide on the turn, spun five wide into the stretch and came up empty. SIGNATOR was off slow and spotted the front a few lengths, settled towards the rear, saved ground on the turn and failed to threaten. BOURBON BASH was forced out at the start, settled between foes early, dropped back inside the three-quarter pole, went five wide on the turn, came six wide into the stretch and failed to respond. BREW PUB moved out leaving the chute, raced at the rear, moved from three to five wide under urging on the turn and was no factor. CAPTURE THE FLAG was off slow and spotted the front a few lengths, settled on the outside, dropped back in the four path on the turn, drifted inward in upper stretch and faltered.

ENTRY.NAME: Cape Trafalgar
ENTRY.COMMENT: brk out,hit gate,well placed,ins-2p turn,4w1/4,bid ins1/8,denied

ENTRY.NAME: Signator
ENTRY.OWNER: West Point Thoroughbreds Woodford Racing LLC Gainesway Stable (Antony Beck) Phip
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, settled, inside turn, no threat

ENTRY.NAME: Brew Pub
ENTRY.OWNER: Rodriguez Rudy R Imperio Michael and Scuderi Vincent S
ENTRY.COMMENT: moved out leaving chute,well back,3-5w turn,no factor

ENTRY.NAME: Bad to the Bones
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, roused 3-4wide turn, 5wide into lane, empty

ENTRY.NAME: Frat Pack
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled brk,set pressured pace,ins foe,headed3/16,weakened

ENTRY.NAME: Twelth Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled, urged 2path-ins turn, failed to rally

ENTRY.NAME: Everso Mischievous
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke out,pressed outside,3p turn,lead3/16,responded,held sway

ENTRY.NAME: Bourbon Bash
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out brk,btwn foes,drop back5-1/2,5w turn,6w1/4,no response

ENTRY.NAME: Capture the Flag
ENTRY.OWNER: Allen Stable Inc Magnier Mrs John Tabor Michael B Smith Derrick Westerberg Limit
ENTRY.COMMENT: off slow, outside, empty 4path turn, drifted in 3/16, faltered

ENTRY.NAME: Caramel Chip
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked pace,3w turn,asked1/4,angled out ins3/16,no kick

RACE.RACE_TEXT: SARATOGA RACE 12 1 1/16M Inner turf CR: 97. Allowance Purse 149500. (PURSE $115,000 FOR NON-NYB) (UP TO $26,013 NYSBFOA) FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON $18,000 OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR STATE BRED ALLOWANCE OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 125 lbs. Non -winners Of A Race Other Than Claiming Or Starter At A Mile Or Over Allowed 2 lbs. (If the Stewards consider it inadvisable to run this race on the turf course, this race will be run at One Mile on the Main Track). (Rail at 18 feet).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: FAIR DINKUM four then three wide through the first turn, chased three wide coming under coaxing at the three-eighths, continued three wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive taking command a furlong from home, traded leans knocking heads to the finish with BEUYS and gamely prevailed at the end. BEUYS (IRE) three then two wide through the first turn, chased three wide from mid pack, steadily advanced coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung four wide into upper stretch, dug in under a drive rallying to engage in head to head combat with the aforementioned foe trading leans to the finish fighting on game but was ultimately bested at the finish. SHUTTERS tracked the pace along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, spun just off the inside into upper stretch attempting to lean out against a rival, then got bumped back inside by DRAKON holding his path near the three-sixteenths, dug in under a drive behind a foe lacking optimal clearance until just inside the sixteenth marker, rallied on through late and missed at the end. HILLIARD two to three wide in pursuit from near the rear of the field, came under coaxing three furlongs from home, angled out five to six wide into upper stretch, kicked on belatedly to the finish but missed. DANZIGWITHTHESTARS tracked the pace along the inside coming under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, swung three wide for home, offered up a mild kick. DRAKON forwardly placed just off the inside in closest aim of the leader, came under coaxing at the three-eighths, swung three then two wide into upper stretch, got leaned and bumped lightly by SHUTTERS attempting to lean out straightened away and held his lane bumping that foe back inside in behind RUSE with three-sixteenths to go, dug in under a drive keeping on to the wire but was outfinished in the late going. WHAT SAY THEE broke out brushing the off side stall at the start, chased just off the inside from just off the pace, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, angled four to five wide for home, kept on under a drive getting outfinished in the late stages. RUSE established the front and showed the way in hand along the inside, came under coaxing at the five-sixteenths, took the inside route into upper stretch, dug in under a drive under challenge from a host of rivals and was collared just outside the eighth pole, dug in to the finish, one paced to the end. AL'S ROCKET got brushed at the start by ALFIO breaking outwards awkward at the start, chased just off the inside from near the rear of the field, came under coaxing two to three wide at the five-sixteenths, went seven wide into upper stretch and made no impact. ALFIO broke out at the start awkwardly brushing AL'S ROCKET and conceded four to five lengths to the front, raced three wide then two wide through the turn before chasing three to four paths off the inside down the backstretch, tipped four to five wide through the far turn placed to coaxing from the three-eighths, went four wide at the head of the stretch and trailed throughout.

ENTRY.NAME: Shutters
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked ins, 2w 1/4, bumped ins 3/16, beh foe, clr 1/16, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Danzigwiththestars
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked ins, coaxed 5/16, 3w upper, mild kick

ENTRY.NAME: Ruse
ENTRY.COMMENT: in hand ins, coaxed 5/16, inside 1/4, collared 1/8, one paced

ENTRY.NAME: What Say Thee
ENTRY.COMMENT: brush gate st, chased 2p, coaxed 5/16, 4-5w uppr, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Fair Dinkum
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4-3w 1st turn, 3w pursuit, 3w upper, up 1/8, traded leans, game

ENTRY.NAME: Drakon
ENTRY.OWNER: Zilla Racing Stables and Acqua Nova Stable
ENTRY.COMMENT: forwardly placed 2p, 3-2w upper, traded bump 3/16, kept on

ENTRY.NAME: Hilliard
ENTRY.COMMENT: 2-3w pursuit, coaxed 3/8, angled 5-6w upper, belatedly, missed

ENTRY.NAME: Alfio
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward st, 3-2w 1t trn, chased 3-4w, 4w uppr, trailed throughout

ENTRY.NAME: Al's Rocket
ENTRY.COMMENT: brushed st, chased 2p, coaxed 2-3w 5/16, 7w upper, no impact

ENTRY.NAME: Beuys (IRE)
ENTRY.COMMENT: 3-2w 1st turn, chased 3w, coaxed 5/16, 4w upper, dueled, bested
